snippet: The California governor attended a decidedly ceremonial groundbreaking for his high-speed train, a defiant and defining act for Mr. Brown as he enters his final term.
abstract: California Gov Jerry Brown attends ceremonial groundbreaking of high-speed train to link Los Angeles and San Francisco day after being sworn in for his last term; critics note that train, which will cost estimated $67 billion, lacks actual funding, but Brown appears undaunted and committed to making rail part of his legacy.

byline.contributor: Ian Lovett contributed reporting from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: The California governor attended a decidedly ceremonial groundbreaking for his high-speed train, a defiant and defining act for Mr. Brown as he enters his final term.

headline.main: To Gov. Jerry Brown, a Legacy Project; to Critics, a Runaway Train
headline.print_headline: To Brown, a Legacy; to Others, a Runaway Train
